column4: hi! I have installed ubuntu on my macbook but now I cant boot from it!
the installation went fine, i used the whole disk
Did you install with the LiveCD?
What happens when you try to boot Ubuntu?
well I dont have the option to boot ubuntu at all
my notebook does only boot from cd

Ahh, you have to either hold down the option key at boot ( and choose windows, because Apple refuses to acknowledged that any other Operating system besides OSX and windows exists ) or install rEFIt which will give you a boot menu
there is no windows option at boot up
mc__: Did you hold down the option key?
I can only boot from the cd
Do you see the Ubuntu partition in disk utility or from the Ubuntu LiveCD ?
Do you see the Ubuntu partition in disk utility or from the Ubuntu LiveCD ?
do you think it was a mistake that I created a new partition table?
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/MacBook suggests making sure grub is set to install to /dev/sda
